description: Sum of orders of all 2 X 2 matrices with entries mod n.
comments: The order of a matrix M over Z/(nZ) is the smallest k such that M^k is idempotent.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: A. Wilansky, Spectral decomposition of matrices for high school students, Math. Mag. 41 1968 51-59.
prog: (PARI) order(m) = {kk = 1; ok = 0; while (! ok, mk = m^kk; if (mk^2 == mk, ok = 1, kk++);); return(kk);}a(n) = {ret = 0; m = matrix(2, 2); for (i=0, n-1, m[1, 1] = Mod(i, n); for (j=0, n-1, m[1, 2] = Mod(j, n); for (k=0, n-1, m[2, 1] = Mod(k, n); for (l=0, n-1, m[2, 2] = Mod(l, n); ret += order(m););););); return (ret);}
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Albert Wilansky
extensions: The article gives an incorrect value for a(5).
